other_tests.findings: The pancreas demonstrates overall decreased T1 signal with presence of peripancreatic edema and an area of ill-defined fluid collection anterior to the pancreatic tail. There is a small amount of slightly more organized fluid in the pancreaticoduodenal groove, indicating acute pancreatitis. No appreciable areas of necrosis. Multiple gallstones are present, with no evidence of stones in the common bile duct. The liver shows atrophy and nodular contour suggesting changes of fibrosis/cirrhosis. The spleen is enlarged, with suggestion of perigastric varices. Bilateral pleural effusions are noted.
